description: We're running guided walks in Tottenham Hale showcasing Haringey's new council homes and the council's commitment to working with residents on place-making and regeneration as part of our Haringey Deal. The walks start/end at Living Under One Sun in Down Lane Park, where there will be a display about our programme to build 3,000 new council homes by 2031 and our regeneration of Down Lane Park.

factsheet.heading: Tottenham Hale: placemaking together
paragraphs: We are running a series of walking tours through Tottenham Hale and a small exhibition, exploring its history and regeneration, greening, and how Haringey Council has worked with residents and other key stakeholders to co-design and shape the future of this part of the borough.

factsheet.heading: Guided walking tour #1: Bridging the Green Gap
paragraphs: This is a guided walking tour from Living Under One Sun to the allotments along the River Lea and to the Paddock nature reserve. It will explore themes of growing food and green skills in an urban context, community engagement and volunteering, and view the new council homes being completed at Hale Wharf and the new bridges linking Tottenham Hale to the wetlands.

factsheet.heading: Guided walking tour #2: Greening and Co-Design
paragraphs: This guided walking tour will explore Down Lane Park, its regeneration, and the new council homes that are being built at our Ashley Road Depot site (and the greening they will brig about) and completed council homes at Walter Tull House and Rosa Luxemburg Apartments. Key themes are the co-design of the redevelopment and improvements to Down Lane Park as part of the council's commitment to working with residents to shape their local places as part of the Haringey Deal.

factsheet.heading: Guided walk #3: District Centre Framework at 10 years
paragraphs: This guided walking tour will explore how council policies have helped shape the regeneration of Tottenham Hale. The key focus is the District Centre Framework, now approaching 10 years since its adoption. The tour will include newly-completed Walter Tull House (131 new council homes) and the new Welbourne Health Centre, and examine Tottenham Hale's capacity for growth and its offer to residents and businesses as a "15 minute city" with fast rail links to central London and Stansted airport.

factsheet.heading: Guided Walking Tour #4: Visit to RLA Viewing Platform
paragraphs: During the day, we will be running guided walking tours for small groups to the viewing platform on top of Rosa Luxemburg Apartments to give participants a better view of the regeneration and growth across Tottenham Hale.

factsheet.heading: Exhibition: regeneration and new council homes
paragraphs: All our walking tours will start/end at Living Under One Sun, where we will be running a small exhibition about Haringey's regeneration of Tottenham Hale and our council house building programme that is delivering 3,000 new high-quality council homes across the borough by 2031. We will explain how we engage and work with residents, how their feedback helps shape our plans, and how our new homes bring improvements for existing residents.
